titleInfo.title: Death portrait of an African American child, 1860s

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Hand tinted death portrait of an African American child. The child is propped up with pillows and blankets and is wearing a dress. Typewritten description underneath reads "Post Mortum image of early 1860's BLACK slave child." Reverse is inscribed with "From A. BROWN'S/ Photography & Gem GALLERY,/ Cor. Main and Union Avenue,/MEMPHIS, Tenn."

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee

mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
